item.title: CentOS & RHEL and up to date Subversion and Git
item.description: If you’re using CentOS/RHEL 5, 6 or 7, you have noticed bundled subversion and git are quite old. It could be a problem if you need to use smart features, like Sparse Checkout. Also Jenkins Git Plugin recommand version 1.7 or higher. Of course, you could recompile git from sources, but it’s better to use prebuilt packages. Here enter Wandisco Wandisco provides up to date Subversion RPMs for CentOS 5/6/7 :
